Well, we don’t: our festive period is long! We have just finished fantastic Navarathri celebrations (that lasted two weekends this time, after number of years). The Tamil month of Aippasi has started and we are all getting ready for the biggest festival of the year,Deepavali. We wish you very happy extended celebrations time and remain happy through out.

SIS Special Satsang – 29th September 2013 - Update

'Several of SIS members were privileged to attend a special Satsang at the residence of Sundars on 29th September, 2013. Sri Jayendra Puri Swamiji of Kailasha Ashrama graced the occasion and a paduka puja was performed by all those present. As desired by the Swamiji the main event was Tiruppukazh singing led by Mrs Jayanthi Sundar. The swamiji picked a sentence from one of the songs, asked everyone present to sing the line and the song again and used it to develop and deliver an erudite Anugraha Bhasan on Dharma and Moksha. Membership and Participation

South Indian Society as an organisation has come to shape with lots of hard work and contribution from several veterans of our community in this country. We sincerely thank each and every one who has contributed towards the growth of this organisation. This organisation runs for YOU and without YOUR involvement, contribution and participation it cannot succeed.
